roleset.name: read (as in text, or as in assessment)
roleset.note: READ-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls learn-14-1, learn-14-2-1, transfer_mesg-37.1.1-1, register-54.1-1, discover-84-1-1. (from read.01-v)

READING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to read.01.-v VN classes transfer_mesg-37.1.1, transfer_mesg-37.1.1-1, register-54.1-1, learn-14-1, and learn-14-2-1. FN class linguistic_meaning. Framed by Katie. (from reading.01-n)

example.name: not quite a book
example.text: A fund manager at a life-insurance company said three factors make it difficult *trace* to read market direction.

example.name: with direction
example.text: ``My belief is always, if you've got a settlement, you read it into the record.'' says Judge Jenkins, now known in his courthouse as ``Shake 'Em Down Jenkins.''

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: John reads to his children every night.

example.name: book and text
example.text: ``[Due to health reasons, Lt. Col. Noriega has elected to postpone his visit to Washington,]-1'' it read *trace*-1.

example.name: arg1- thing being assessed
example.text: The government issues its first reading on third - quarter real gross national product this week in a report that is expected to disclose much tamer inflation .
example.arg: on third-quarter real gross national product

example.name: more clear arg 2
example.text: And even a truer reason for his reading to himself might have been the care for preserving his voice

example.name: explicit mentions of books = arg 1
example.text: a special reading of Gao's The Night Walker

example.name: This also counts as 'book'
example.text: From a reading of the somewhat scant English - language medical literature on RU - 486
example.arg: of the somewhat scant English - language medical literature on RU - 486

example.name: arg3
example.text: some market analysts say the current 3.3 % reading is n't as troublesome as it might have been in years past .

roleset.name: read_up on something
roleset.note: READ_UP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from read.02-v)
READING_UP-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to read.02. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from reading.02-n)

example.name: both args
example.text: The Nissan Navara was facelifted a wee while back and this made it a much better drive on the road , in the first generation they were like old trucks , *PRO* read up on them .

example.name: both args
example.text: My reading up on this paid off.

roleset.name: recite from a list
roleset.note: READ_OFF-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from read.03-v)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: can they do things like setting BMW memory settings that you normally have to pay a dealer for , or is this only for *PRO* reading off engine stats etc ?

example.name: all args
example.text: So, Mother is sitting there at the hospital, reading off names from some free pamplet she had found, until they finally found one that all three of them liked.
example.arg: from some free pamphlet she had found
until they finally found one that all three of them liked
